1.content:
Hi. My name is Summer Roberts. And, odds are, you've never met anyone like me before.

When my story began, I was 17, a senior at Pierce High. I was the oldest of three children, all girls. Sam was 14, and Becca was 12. A lot of people just meeting the family mistook Sam for the oldest, and Becca for my twin sister. That's because I was so short.

You don't believe I was ever short? Well, I was: 5', 0". Not only was I the shortest girl in my senior class, I was the shortest girl in Pierce High, quite possibly the shortest ever.

Being short was a pain. Always having to show my ID to prove I was old enough. And constantly being overlooked ("Oh, sorry, didn't see you there." Repeat to infinity.)

But all that changed, forever, because of a class trip...
1.title: My Story

11.content:
We were invited to tour a chemical plant. Since it got us out of class, a lot of us agreed to go. I wished I'd thought of that before I signed on. As it was, I couldn't see anything that the guide was pointing out, because I was surrounded by my fellow students. Shortest one in the class, remember?

"Over there," said the guide, "we are working on a revolutionary new fertilizer. We hope to be able to grow fruits and vegetables much larger than normally, and in a fraction of the time."

Sounds interesting, I thought. Too bad I don't have a chance in hell of seeing it.

Well, we kept going for a while longer, until my purse strap came undone. "Hold up," I called, as I put it back together.

When I had done so, however, I looked up to find no sign of the rest of the class. They don't notice when I'm there, why would they notice when I'm not?

I wandered around, trying to find some sign of the group.

My wandering took me into what looked like a greenhouse. Aisle after aisle of fruits and veggies. This is as good a place to wait as anywhere else, I thought, helping myself to a strawberry.

Right then, I was sprayed.

I couldn't think of what it could possibly be. All I knew was that it reeked to high heaven, and it felt simultaneously hot and cold as it soaked through my clothes. "Help!" I screamed, and discovered that it tasted even worse than it smelled.

I don't know how long I was sprayed for, but somebody finally shut it off, and I was grabbed by people in hazmat suits. I couldn't hear much, with my ears full of that stuff, but I picked up "untested on animal life," and assorted questions about why the doors weren't locked.

I was carried off to the showers, where three of the hazmat team stripped me naked and scrubbed me, under water that was so hot that it felt like I was being scalded.

The end of the shower was no relief, as they immediately poured something down my throat. "It's an emetic," said a woman. Before I could ask what an emetic was, I found out, by immediately puking my guts out.

I was finally dressed in some scrubs, with the cuffs rolled up. "You should be alright," said the same woman who gave me the emetic, a woman Mom's age. "If you notice anything out of the ordinary, contact us immediately."

I was finally reunited with the tour group, and got to hear endless variations on "Nice outfit, Short Stuff."
11.title: The Fateful Day

choices: They're Just as Excited as I Am
They're Suspicious of My Growth Spurt
111.content:
You know how sore your legs are the day after you ran a super-long way? That's how my whole body felt on the third day after the accident.

I was glad it was the weekend; that meant I could maybe take a long, warm bath (the chemical plant had altered my definition of hot, as well as souring me on showers for the foreseeable future). I threw off the covers and sat up.

That's when I noticed it: my pajamas were tight. And I mean tight.

I looked in my full-length mirror, and I couldn't believe it. My top was straining to contain my boobs, and my bottoms were riding up on my calves like I thought a flood was coming.

How had my pajamas shrunk while I was wearing them? Or could it be... ?

I grabbed a pencil and went to the door frame, where Mom had marked off my height until it became clear that I had stopped growing. Standing against the door frame, I marked off where I stood, then turned to look.

No doubt about it, I had grown.

Taking out a ruler, I measured the difference. "Three inches."

I was now 5', 3" tall.

I ran downstairs to tell Mom and Dad.
111.title: Growing Pains

1111.content:
Mom and Dad were awake and having coffee when I came down. "Mom, Dad, I grew!"

"You did?" Mom asked. "Yes, your pajamas do look a little small for you."

"Three whole inches!" I crowed.

Mom double-checked my measurements with a tape measure. "Yep, you're five-three, alright. Congratulations, Summer, you finally grew."

I bounced around the room, I was so happy. "I won't be the shortest girl in school anymore!"

"Now, now," Dad said, "let's not get too excited. Yes, you grew, but girls your age have generally stopped growing. Don't get your hopes up about getting much taller."

"Oh, Jerry, let her be happy," Mom said. Grabbing the tape measure again, she took my other measurements. "I've got to know what size to ask for, when I buy your new clothes."

With my measurements complete, Mom went off to buy me new clothes. Both my parents had a point, I thought: I probably wouldn't get much bigger, but the fact that I had finally grown could only be good news.

As it turned out, both my parents were wrong. But none of us knew that yet.
1111.title: They're Just as Excited as I Am

11111.content:
Upon returning to school the following Monday, I showed everyone that I had grown three inches. Unfortunately, I did not receive the response I was hoping for. Most of the girls my age merely giggled, telling me that I got lucky. The boys were not impressed at all, telling me that i was still the shortest kid in school. Apparently, three inches was only a big deal to me. I was approached by one of the teachers, Ms. Swanson, who pulled me aside to talk to me. She was beautiful, with long flowing auburn hair and gentle blue eyes. Standing at seven feet even, she was the tallest woman I had ever met. She taught world history.

"Believe it or not, I, too, was the shortest kid in my class, Summer." Softly, she said. "A lot of people called me Short Stuff, and Half Pint..." She sighed, maintaining her smile. "It did hurt, so I understand your excitement, growing a whole three inches overnight."

"Dad told me not to get my hopes up in getting much taller, but I have hope..." Tearfully, I said.

"It doesn't hurt to dream, Summer." Smiling, Ms. Swanson said. "Being tall in height is not as important as being big at heart."

Ms. Swanson and I shared a hug, making me feel better. As we broke the hug, she whispered to me, "I have a feeling your growth spurts are just beginning."

That made me feel a lot better, though I wondered how she possibly could know for certain.

I woke up the next morning to discover...
11111.title: Showing Off My New Height

111111.content:
The first thing I noticed when my alarm went off was how much my whole body hurt. I seriously thought about asking Mom to call me in sick. I reached out to shut off the alarm,... and missed.

What?

I looked, and my hand had gone past the alarm.

Then, I remembered: The last time I woke up this sore was when I grew.

I got up. My days-old nightie didn't come down past my knees, like it did when I put it on last night.

I marked my height, and got out the tape measure. "Five feet, six inches!" I crowed.

The whole family came running. "Looks like I was wrong, kiddo," Dad said.

"Damn, sis, you're just about normal," noted Sam.

"Not enough time to take you shopping," Mom said. "I'm five-eight. If you don't mind wearing some of my clothes, they won't look too baggy on you."

"Good enough," I replied. After all, it's not like I could have anticipated another growth spurt.

Not yet, anyway.
111111.title: I was even taller.

1111111.content:
People couldn't believe their eyes when I walked into school. I was no longer the shortest girl in school. In fact, I was taller than some of the boys.

"What is your secret, Summer?" asked Vera Chandler.

I shrugged. "Must be a late bloomer, I guess."

Kyle Dennis looked me over. "You look familiar," he said. "Do I know you?"

"Summer Roberts," I replied.

"Summer Roberts? But she's a pipsqueak, a runt!"

"Not anymore."

"So, what are you doing Friday night?"

"Well, I was going to go over... " I saw Vera shaking her head. "I mean, nothing. Why?"

"Wanna go to the movies? Thought we'd check out that new one. You know, kids grow wings?"

"I'd like that."

"Okay. I'll talk to you Friday, find out if anything's changed."

******************************


"I can't believe I have a date Friday night," I said, as Mom and I went shopping for new clothes.

"I'm happy for you, dear," Mom replied. "Really, I am. But I'm not sure you'll be able to go."

"Why not?"

"Suppose you have another growth spurt? You're growing so fast."

"So I'll be taller."

"Summer, I'd be lying if I said I wasn't concerned. You've grown six inches in a week. That isn't normal."

"Relax, Mom. How much bigger can I really get?"

Yeppers, I really asked that.
1111111.title: The Boys Take Notice

11111111.content:
As Mom predicted, I had another growth spurt.

By now, Dad was also telling me he was worried. "Nobody grows nine inches in less than a week, Summer. This isn't normal. What if it isn't healthy?"

"Dad, I feel fine."

"Summer." I felt a hand on my arm.

I turned. Becca was looking up at me.

"We're scared, Summer. We're all scared. Except for you."

That's when it clicked into place. I had grown like crazy, and maybe I still was. Mom and Dad weren't being like this because they didn't want me to go out with boys and have fun. They were worried about what was causing me to shoot up so fast. And they weren't the only ones. In fact, the only one who could be described as "the only one" ... was me.

"Monday," I said. "If it's not better by Monday, I'll go to the doctor. Tonight, I have a date."

******************************


Kyle was surprised to see I'd grown again, but he still wanted to go out with me, just like I wanted to go out with him. Mom and Dad hid their concerns when Kyle came to pick me up. "I want her back by 11:00," Dad said .

"The movie was fun," I said. "I think that's the first time I've ever been charged adult admission."

"You know," Kyle said, "we've still got time. There's no reason tonight has to end right now."

"What did you have in mind?"

"Ever been up on the old town road?"

I shook my head. Who would bring me there, Mom and Dad? The boys saw me as basically a child until recently, so this was my very first date.

"Wanna go?" Naive as I might be, I knew what he was really asking.

"Let's go," I said.

As we headed for the local make-out spot, I was thinking, After tonight, my life will never be the same.

How right I was.
11111111.title: 5', 9" on Date Night

111111111.content:
"Did you bring protection?" I asked.

Kyle smiled, and opened the glove compartment. A box of condoms, still in the factory seal, was sitting right there.

Satisfied, I asked, "Where do you want to... ?"

"I've got a blanket in the trunk. We can do it under the stars."

I know I said I was naive, but it sounded romantic to me, not at all like "I want to have sex with you on the ground, with just a thin cloth between your ass and the dirt."

Nevertheless, it felt wonderful. When we finished, we lay looking up at the stars.

"How was it for you?" Kyle asked.

I opened my mouth,...

... And my answer was cut off by an explosion of agony that tore a scream from my lips.

"What is it? Are - are you hurt? Where?"

"Ev-everywhere," I managed to choke out.

"Everywhere? Why? What's going... Summer, you... you're growing."

That's when I realized that, as sore as I was when I woke up to find a growth spurt, that was just the aftereffects.

I heard someone jump into a car, turn the ignition, and roar out of there like I was catching.

When I could finally raise my head, it was somehow neither surprising nor depressing to see that it had been Kyle. He saw me grow, and took off, leaving me with nothing but extra inches, a ratty old blanket, and clothes that I knew would be too small for me anymore. And no way to get home except walking.
111111111.title: The Old Town Road

1111111111.content:
I don't know why, but I was not sad or angry that Kyle just up and left me lying on the ground, or that he did not even say that he was going for help. I felt numb... in body and mind, as if I had been completely broken. I was walking down the sidewalk, completely naked minus the torn and tattered blanket around me. Yet I did not feel broken in spirit, somehow, at least not at that point, I was more on automatic pilot, with only getting home on my mind. A few cars passed, but no one seemed to take notice of a naked girl walking away from Old Town Road. I could only guess that I was not the only girl left abandoned there.

It began to rain, but I really did not take that much notice. I walked steadily, mechanically, my mind in a bit of a fog, until bright headlights and the sound of a horn pulled me slightly out of my trance. I casually turned to see a tall figure stepping out of an SUV. Then a familiar voice reached my ears, sending me back into reality... "Summer!"

It was like a sequence in a dream. I stood there, tears swelling, then running down my face, as Ms Swanson quickly wrapped a warm blanket around me, before taking me into her powerful arms. I was carried into her SUV, where she buckled me into the passenger seat. After closing the passenger side door, she hurried back into the car and began to drive me home. That was when i lost it, crying and shivering from the betrayal and fear. I only stopped when Ms Swanson spoke. "When your parents told me that you were going on a date with Kyle, I knew that you would need some help." Serious, she said. "Kyle is known for leaving girls hanging after the first date. Had I known he asked you out, I would have warned you." She paused. "Did you and he make love...?"

Embarrassed, I nodded. "How- How did you know?" Shivering, I asked.

"Your parents and I have been friends for years." Smiling, Ms Swanson replied. "When they are concerned, they call me for advice, and I do the same."

I shook my head. "How did you know about Kyle?"

Ms Swanson sighed. "A lot of girls come to me when they are distraught, because of my size." Calmly, she replied. "They feel safe with me, as most of the boys and men fear me." She let out a low giggle. "If they only knew..."

"If they only knew what?" Curious, I asked.

"I was the runt of my family." Honestly, Ms Swanson said. "If they think I'm tall,..."

To say I was surprised would have been an understatement. "Do- Do you know why I'm growing so fast, Ms Swanson?"

"I hesitate to even guess, Summer." Serious, Ms Swanson replied. "I'm a history teacher, not a doctor, I suggest you seek professional help." She then handed me a small bag. "These are some clothes I used to wear when I was around your age, they should fit you."

Looking at the clothes, I blushed slightly, seeing that they were all custom made to stretch to fit several sizes bigger than myself. "Thank- thank you."

Ms Swanson smiled kindly. "You are welcome, and don't worry about Kyle." Softly, she said. "First, he's sterile, so there is no chance of you being pregnant. Also, I have already notified his parents of his latest stunt. He is on thin ice with them as it is."

"He was scared..." Wincing, I said.

"Don't make excuses for those who wrong you." Scolding, Ms Swanson said. "It only makes you more of a victim."

I managed to get dressed in the new clothing Ms Swanson gave me before she got me home, and was carried by her into the house. There, Mom and Dad were both concerned and angry after she told them what had happened. "Don't blame your daughter for this." Serious, Ms Swanson said. "Kyle has a way to sort of hypnotize his victims with a silver tongue. She was victimized, just like a lot of other girls were by him."

"At least he's sterile." Angry, Mom said. She turned to me. "You need to be more careful with your choice of dates, young lady."

"Yes, Mom..." Crying, I said.

"Enough of that." Serious, Dad said. "Summer is the victim here, and we need to take steps to see that it does not happen again." He then turned to me. "If Kyle ever gives you any trouble, you call me right away, is that understood?"

I nodded, though still crying. "Yes, Dad..."

Dad nodded, satisfied. "I'll make you some hot chocolate, with extra marshmallows, and then you are going straight to the emergency room."
1111111111.title: Ms. Swanson to the Rescue

11111111111.content:
"Good evening," said the doctor as she entered the exam room. "I'm Dr. Phillips. It says here that you've been... growing?"

I nodded. "Last week, I wasn't a hair over five feet tall. Now, I'm six feet. And three of those extra inches weren't there three hours ago."

"Hm. Well, I can honestly say that's something I've never heard before. Tell you what, I'll order some blood work, we'll see how things look after that."

After a nurse drew my blood, Dr. Phillips said, "Now, this last growth spurt, were you doing anything unusual before it happened?"

"Well,... " I looked over at Mom and Dad.

Dr. Phillips turned to them. "If we could have some privacy?"

Once they were out of the room, Dr. Phillips turned back to me. "You don't want them to know, or you're just not comfortable talking about it in front of them?"

"Not comfortable. They already know. I was making love with a boy."

"I see. Did you take anything unusual before it happened?"

"No, we went to the movies."

"I see. Did you use protection?"

"We used a condom."

"And you only used it once?"

"We only did it once. Then I got this horrible pain all over my body, and I grew another three inches."

"And where is he now?"

I shook my head. "He left me on Old Town Road with nothing but a ratty blanket. I don't care where he is right now."

A nurse brought Dr. Phillips a sheet of paper. "Well, that can't be right. I'm going to have to redo this, I'm sorry."

I gave her another blood sample.

When Dr. Phillips got the results from this second test, she called Mom and Dad back in. "I'm admitting Summer," she said. "There's a hormone in her system that I've never seen before, and the levels are... astronomical. Let's figure out where this came from."
11111111111.title: At the ER

111111111111.content:
Observation.

Sounds pleasant, doesn't it? Passive, even. You do whatever it is you do, and we'll observe.

Well, let me tell you, in a hospital, putting someone under observation is the least passive thing you can do to them.

Under observation, I was measured five times a day. I couldn't use the bathroom, because they wanted to study my pee and my poo. (Seriously, they did that.) They looked at everything I ate and drank, and, if I left something, they studied it. And they made me exercise, and you can bet your ass they observed that, too.

"What the hell are you looking for?" I asked during one session.

"I'll let you know when I see it," the nurse observing me replied.

"It's been two days," I said. "I promise, if this thing had an on/off switch, I would have duct taped it down before Friday night."

Mom and Dad picked that moment to visit. "How are you doing, sweetie?" Mom asked.

"If I don't go stir crazy," I answered, "I'll go crazy from paranoia." I took a sip from a water bottle. "You wouldn't believe what people here find inter-"

I was interrupted by an explosion of agony all over my body, and I cried out.

The nurse sprang into action. "Summer? What's happening?"

"G-growing," I said. This time, I could feel my body swelling to its new proportions.

As soon as I could stand, my nurse put me against the wall and measured me. She needed Dad's help to read it. "Six feet, three inches."

"And zero answers," I said.

"Count again."

We all looked. Dr. Phillips had arrived, along with Emetic Lady from the chemical plant.

"We know what's happening to you, Summer," Dr. Phillips said, "and we know what's causing it."
111111111111.title: Observation

1111111111111.content:
"First," Dr. Phillips said, "let me introduce my colleague, Dr. Jacobs. She has provided us with the last piece of the puzzle before us."

Dr. Jacobs walked up to me. "It's good to see you again, Summer," she said, "although I wish it were under different circumstances." Turning to address the room, she said, "Last week, Summer toured the chemical plant where I work, and found her way into a room that should have been restricted. There, she was doused in a revolutionary new hormone designed to stimulate growth in plants. We thought we had taken sufficient steps to prevent any negative effects. Unfortunately, we were wrong."

"That's the hormone we found in your system Friday night, Summer," added Dr. Phillips. "And it's that hormone that's driving your growth now."

"Alright," Mom said. "So it's this hormone that's causing my daughter problems. Now, how do we get it out of her system before things get worse?"

"I'm afraid it's not that simple, Mrs. Roberts," said Dr. Phillips. "Summer's body is not simply reacting to the presence of this hormone. Her body is producing the hormone now. Putting her on hormone blockers would drastically affect her health."

I guess it fell to me to ask the important question: "So, how big am I going to get?"

Like I said, it was a good question. I just wish that the answer I got from Dr. Jacobs was more satisfying:

"We don't know."
1111111111111.title: The Answer

11111111111111.content:
"I'm afraid all we can do is wait until you stop growing." Wincing, Dr. Jacobs said.

"I can prescribe you some pain medication, to help you better ride out the growth spurts." Kindly, Dr Phillips said. She sighed. "Other than that, there is nothing more we can do for you."

I sighed at that, wanting to scream. Only I was surprised when a knock came to my hospital room door before Ms Swanson entered. "Summer... I brought my little brother to see you." Softly, she said. "His name is Dr. Paul Bunyan, he specializes in your condition."

"As in the legendary giant lumberjack, Paul Bunyan?" Curious, Dr. Jacobs asked.

"The same." Starting all, a deep voice replied.

We all turned and were shocked to see a towering man literally duck low to enter the room. He was at least ten feet tall. "Compose yourselves, Doctor Phillips, Doctor Jacobs." Calmly, Dr Bunyan said. "You are supposed to be professionals."

"Do you have any answers for this, doctor?" Wincing, Mom asked.

Dr. Bunyan nodded. "It's partially genetic." Calmly, he said. "You see, Mrs. Roberts, your father was my great uncle. That said, our 'giant gene' as we so affectionately call it, is within you and your daughter."

"So that chemical shower she got at the plant affected that gene?" Gulping, Mom asked.

"No, it stimulated her body into producing the hormone responsible for her painful growth spurts." Serious, Dr. Bunyan said. "As to how big you can grow, it varies."

"On what?" Wincing, I demanded.

Dr. Bunyan smiled. "The same as any other growth spurts." Kindly, he replied. "Nutrition, diet, exercise, and so on." He sighed. "If you really want to know how big you can get, look at pictures of your grandfather."

"How tall is her grandfather?" Curious, Dr. Jacobs asked.

Dr Phillips sighed. "Mr. Towers is sensitive about his height." Serious, she replied. "Sorry, but doctor, patient confidentiality..."

Mom then carefully whispered into my ear, "He's over twelve feet tall, a Guinness Book of World Records holder..."

I had never met my grandfather, just my grandmother, so this news was hard to take. I fainted.
11111111111111.title: Family ties.

111111111111111.content:
Normally, Mom rode in the front passenger seat when Dad drove, and vice versa. However, on the ride home, Mom gave it to me. "You need the legroom more than I do, Summer," she said.

I didn't give it much thought. I was busy thinking, How long before I outgrow the car?

When we got home, Sam and Becca were waiting for us. The last they'd seen me was when I left for my date, three days and six inches ago. Needless to say, they were shocked when I stepped out of the car. "Wow, Summer," Becca said, "you're huge!"

"Becca, hush," Sam said.

I just looked at Becca and said, "If you think this is huge, sis,... just wait." Then I went up to my bedroom, trying not to think about, one day, having to duck to get through the door, and also trying not to imagine myself recreating that scene from Alice in Wonderland.

After a while, there was a knock on the door. "May I come in, Summer?" Mom asked.

"Okay."

She came in. "The pharmacist told me that your pain meds have a kick, so maybe we should save them for when you're about due for a growth spurt."

"Too bad we don't know when that is," I replied.

Mom sat on the edge of my bed. "Actually, your growth spurts have been fairly consistent. The only exception was on your date."

"So why did it hit me then?"

"Well, I have a theory about that. I could tell you about it, if you don't mind hearing your mother talk about such things."

"After being under observation, you'll have to go pretty far to embarrass me."

"Perhaps. Now, before that growth spurt, you and Kyle had been... intimate, hadn't you?"

"Ugh, don't remind me."

"Well, when you're making love, your heart races, you breathe heavily. And your orgasm sends hormones racing through your system. Since your system is chock full of hormones right now, your body thought it was time to grow."

"I guess that makes sense."

Mom smiled. "Well, I think we'll get pizza for supper. What toppings do you want?"

"Extra large meat lover's."

"You want a whole extra large pizza for yourself?"

I shrugged. "I'm hungry."
111111111111111.title: Returning home.

choices: Later, lunch with grandma and grandpa.
1111111111111111.content:
Just before lunch, we went to visit my grandpa for the very first time. Mom called ahead to inform him we were coming, and why, so it was no surprise when we saw Grandma waiting for us by the door of their house. From the outside, it looked like a spacious three-story mansion, with enough room for the entire family to visit. However, the front door took up two stories, which gave a hint of the true nature of the inside.

Upon walking in, I was awestruck to find the house was a single story, with three story high painted ceilings. Massive stone pillars held the structure up, giving an ancient Greek vibe. "Welcome to our humble home, Summer." Hugging me, Grandma said. "Grandpa will be in shortly, he's preparing lunch." She smiled. "I hope you are hungry."

"I'm starving..." Smiling back, I said.

A deep chuckle caught my attention and I turned to see Grandpa walking into the room. He stood at a mind-blowing twelve and a half feet tall. Sam and Becca both took a step back, but relaxed at Grandpa's gentle smile. I could only stare thinking, Am I really going to be that tall...?

"A little birdie told me that one of my grandchildren is having a few growth spurts." Kindly, Grandpa said. "Could someone point that person out for me?"

I laughed at that. It was the first time I had laughed since my disastrous date with Kyle. "That's me, Grandpa..."

"Summer's been a bit depressed for a few days, Dad," Sighing, dad said. "Frankly, so have we."

Grandpa scoffed. "You get that from your grandmother." Lightly, he said.

"Ahem!" Tapping one foot, Grandma scolded.

Grandpa blushed. "Fine, you get it from me."

I giggled at that, breaking the ice further. Everyone began to relax as Grandma turned to me. "What Grandpa is trying to say is that you are welcome to stay here with us when you outgrow your parent's house." Calmly, she said. "We have a spare bedroom for guests we can make to accommodate you."

I teared up, smiling. "It's a beautiful house, Grandma and Grandpa."

"I'm glad to hear you say that." Smiling, grandpa said. "When my siblings come to visit, they always ask me, Couldn't you have found anything bigger, half-pint?"

"Your siblings call you half-pint?" Surprised, I asked. "Why?"

Grandpa motioned to a large framed photograph on the wall. "The same reason your siblings call you short-stuff." Simply, he said. "My father is nearly one hundred feet tall, with my older brother close to fifty feet." He sighed. "The 'giant gene' skips a generation here and there."

"But... you're a Guinness Book of World Records holder..." Feeling faint, I said.

Grandpa shook his head. "Nominated for the book, not added." Serious, he countered. "That rumor was a joke from my younger brother, who stood at forty feet the last time I saw him."

Looking at the photograph of Grandpa literally being dwarfed by his parents and siblings became too much for me. Luckily, Grandpa still had sharp reflexes. He caught me when I fainted.
1111111111111111.title: Visiting Grandpa

11111111111111111.content:
"More mac and cheese, Summer?" Grandma asked.

I held out my plate for a third helping. "I'm sorry," I said, "you must think I'm a complete pig."

"Oh, nonsense. You're not a pig. You're a growing girl."

The tone of her voice, and the kiss she placed on my temple, made what was happening to me seem so... normal.

And I realized, to Grandpa's family, it was normal. As much as growing so much was freaking me out, it was only to be expected in this house. For the very first time since the day of that awful date, the prospect of growing more conjured up feelings other than terror.

"Whatever," Sam said. "I'm just glad I won't be growing like that."

"You don't know that," Dad said. "Summer certainly never thought she would. But one accident was all it took to trigger her dormant genes. There may be other triggers out there. Either one of you could find yourself in Summer's shoes."
11111111111111111.title: Later, lunch with grandma and grandpa.

111111111111111111.content:
A couple days later, I was due for a growth spurt, so Mom gave me my pain meds. Mom wasn't kidding about a kick: three hours after I woke up, I went upstairs to lie down.

I was staring into space, not thinking about anything, when I felt it. I looked down the length of my body, and watched my feet shoot off the edge of the bed.

Hang on, I thought, I shouldn't be growing this much.

I shouldn't have, but I was expanding to fill my bedroom. I curled up to avoid damaging the walls.

Instead, my growing body exploded out of the house.

I stood up in the wreckage, still growing. I heard the terrified voices of Sam and Becca, asking where Mom and Dad were, followed by their anguished screams when I shuffled my feet. And still I grew.

I began to tower over skyscrapers, knocking them over with every move. I just kept growing, destroying more and more under my feet.

Before long, there was no longer a planet Earth. Instead, the new third planet from the sun was Summer Roberts. And I was still growing.

I closed my eyes, not wanting to see any more of the destruction wreaked by my growing body.

"Sweetie?"

I opened my eyes. Mom was standing over me. I was in my bedroom. It was just a dream.

I pulled Mom to me. "Don't go," I begged, "don't go, don't go, don't go."

"Bad dream?"

"I destroyed everything, I grew so much."

Mom ran her fingers through my hair. "You know you won't grow like that. It was just a dream, Summer."

I looked into Mom's eyes. "I don't think I want to take those pills anymore."

"That bad, huh?"

"Any pain is better than dreams like... oh, boy."

I'll give the pills this much, all I felt was the swelling as I grew.

When I could stand, I marked my height myself, and I measured myself: 6', 6". "I still don't want to take those pills anymore."

"Alright, Summer, we'll find something else. Now, since you've stopped growing again, how about I go get us lunch? Six cheeseburgers?"

"Eight."

"Eight. Alright, I'll be back."
111111111111111111.title: Trying the Pain Meds

1111111111111111111.content:
Just as Mom left my bedroom, I heard her say, "Mom, what are you doing here?"

"I'm here to help my granddaughter, of course." Sweetly, Grandma replied. "Don't you fret, dear. I have a lot of experience raising a growing family..."

Soon after, Grandma walked into my bedroom, with a kind smile on her face. "I take it the hospital gave you some pills for pain." Softly, she said.

I nodded. "They did, but the dreams they spark are not worth it." Wincing, I said.

Grandma giggled. "That's why doctors call what they do practice." Calmly, she said. "There is always something new to learn when it comes to medicine." She then handed me a large bottle sealed with a cork. "This will help you more than any pill."

"What is it?" Curious, I asked.

"It's an ointment, passed down from generation to generation on your father's side of the family." Kindly, Grandma explained. "Your father does not believe in home remedies, but that is where medicine has its beginnings, and, sometimes, the old ways work better than the new."

"Am I supposed to drink this?" Wincing, I asked.

Grandma giggled. "Do, and I guarantee it won't stay down long." Bemused, she replied. "You rub it onto your body after a shower, like sunscreen. It numbs your body to the point you will not feel the growth spurts when they happen."

I got up and hugged Grandma. "Thank you." Grateful, I said. I then sighed. "I'm going to need to buy new clothes again."

Grandma again giggled before shaking her head. "I already took care of that, dear." Grinning, she said. "I brought you some of your aunts' old clothing to wear."

I winced at the thought of borrowing 'yesterday's' clothes. "No offense, Grandma, but..."

My protest died in my throat as Grandma turned and brought in a box filled with clothing that looked exactly like the latest new craze at the mall. Seeing my shock, Grandma laughed. "Fashion tends to repeat itself after a few generations." Bemused, she explained. "It's an age-old trick to save clothing companies millions in coming up with new designs."

"So these are the original new craze." Smiling, I said. "Grandma, you rock!"

Grandma smiled. "It was actually your mother's idea." Surprising me, she said. "You might not know it, but she rocks, too."

I smiled back. "Yes, she does..."
1111111111111111111.title: Grandma to the Rescue

11111111111111111112.content:
The next morning, I was awakened, not by my alarm clock, but by a scream.

I jumped out of bed (sorry, Dad, for making the house shake) and walked as fast as I dared in the direction of the screaming, which was Becca's room. I knocked on the door. "Becca? Becca, it's Summer. Can I come in?"

I could hear the tears in her voice as she said, "Okay."

I opened the door and stepped inside. "What's wrong, honey?"

"This!" she wailed, showing me her arms.

It took me a minute to realize what I was looking at: the sleeves of her nightgown didn't go the length of her arms. "I'm growing, too!"

I hunkered down and put my hand on her shoulder. "Yes, you're growing. Just like you were growing before."

She was inconsolable. "I'm gonna be huge!"

"Let's measure." I put her against the door frame, marked her height, and measured. "You're an inch taller than last time Mom measured you. Not everyone who grows gets up to my height. This is the same kind of growing you were so proud of when you were going to be taller than I was."

"R-really?"

"Really. Don't worry about it, Becca, you're not going to be huge."

Mom and Dad came up. "It's okay," I told them. "She's growing, but not growing growing."

"Thank you," Becca said.

I shrugged. "What are big sisters for? C'mon, let's see how hungry you are."
11111111111111111112.title: Becca starts to grow.

choices: underclassmen start coming to me for protection.
I am approached by a WNBA scout.
111111111111111111121.content:
At school, I met up with Ms Swanson, who greeted me with a kind smile. "I see you are getting up in the world." Teasing, she said. "How do you feel?"

"A little better, thanks to an ointment Grandma gave me." Honestly, I replied. "That, and some clothes Mom and my aunt donated."

"I can see you're wearing the original fashion craze." Bemused, Ms Swanson said. "Not everyone realizes that, like history, fashion repeats."

I giggled at that. "I'll be living with Grandma and Grandpa when or if I outgrow my parent's house." Calmly, I said. "Their place is huge."

"I have visited on occasion." Nodding, Ms Swanson said.

We stopped talking as we saw Kyle approaching. "Hey, Summer." Sickly sweet, he said. "My folks sort of demanded I apologize to you, so... sorry."

"It would have had more meaning if you had apologized sooner, and without being ordered to." Unimpressed, I said. "You left me alone up there, without any clothes, with a rain storm coming."

"I promise that won't happen again, Summer." Putting on a smile, Kyle said. "We all deserve a second chance, right... ? I'm willing to give you one, as you did sort of get me into trouble."

I could not believe the nerve of the boy in front of me. He was talking as if I was the one who needed to apologize and be given a second chance. I turned to Ms Swanson, who had a knowing grin on her face. It took me a minute to realize that I didn't have to tilt my neck as much to look into her eyes. I had grown another three inches. I turned to Kyle, who had become suddenly nervous.

"You're right, Kyle." Sternly, I said. "This will never happen again, because I am never going out with you again." I then grabbed him by the shirt collar and easily lifted him to my eye level. "Also, you will never pull that stunt on another girl, unless you want to awaken a sleeping giant."

All of the color ran from Kyle's five-foot-six frame before he quickly nodded. I gently put him back onto his feet and released him. Kyle ran off like a shot, not daring to look back. I turned, hearing Ms Swanson giggling. "While I cannot condone violence on school property, I also cannot deny that boy had it coming to him."

I smiled at that, then hurried off to class as the bell rang...

The rest of the day was filled with questions and remarks about my unusual growth spurts, to which I could only shrug. "I dunno,... I'm a high school student, not a doctor."
111111111111111111121.title: At School

1111111111111111111212.content:
Sam and I ate together, as usual. "Holy cow," she said, "did you grow again?"

"Six-nine," I confirmed, putting down the grocery bag full of my lunch, and the large thermos full of milk.

We got plenty of attention, mostly from girls who had heard about Kyle, thanking me for putting him in his place. But I was surprised when a woman I'd never seen before came up to me. "Who might you be?" she asked.

"Somebody who doesn't talk to strangers," I replied.

"Vanessa Potter," she said. "I'm a recruiter for the WNBA. Now, may I ask you your name?"

"Summer Roberts."

"Delighted to meet you, Summer. I'm sure I'm not the first person to tell you this, but I couldn't help noticing you. How's your game?"

"She rots," Sam said.

"I never played," I said. "Too short."

"You?! Too short?!"

"Two weeks ago," Sam said, "she needed high heels if she wanted to be over 5 feet tall."

"Two weeks? What happened?"

I shrugged. "Partly genetics. Partly environmental."

******************************


Mom couldn't believe her eyes when she came to pick us up. "I guess I know the headlines of your day. Throw your books in the trunk, let's go."

I moved the seat back as far as it would go, and my legs were still bent. "Sit up straight, Summer," Mom said.

"I can't."

Mom looked at me. The back of my head touched the ceiling of the car. "Maybe you should set your alarm earlier."

I knew what that meant: I was too big for the car.

"So," Mom asked, "what else happened today?"

"Summer got approached by a recruiter for the WNBA," Sam said.

"Summer?" Becca asked. "But I'm way better than she is."

"True," Mom said, "but you're in junior high. Anything else?"

"I scared the cra... crud out of Kyle Dennis. Picked him right up off the ground."

"You should know better, Summer."

"He wanted me to apologize to him for getting him in trouble with his folks."

"And all you did was pick him up? I admire your restraint. By the way, Dr. Phillips called. She wants to know how you're doing."
1111111111111111111212.title: I am approached by a WNBA scout.

11111111111111111112121.content:
"Whoa," Dr. Phillips said upon seeing me. "What a difference a week makes, huh?"

"Indeed," I replied.

"I'm glad you came in today, Summer. How are you?"

"I've outgrown the car. That's the major drawback."

"Bummer. How are the pain meds I prescribed working out?"

I shook my head. "I quit them the first time. I was zonked out, and I had horrible dreams."

"How horrible?"

"My regular dreams, it's like, I'm in front of the class, and I grow out of my clothes. On the pills, I dreamed that I grew so much that I destroyed the world."

"Yeah, I can see why you decided to stop taking it. What are you doing, instead?"

"I've got this ointment that I put on after I shower. I'm awake when I should be, I don't have any weird dreams, and I hardly noticed my last growth spurt."

"Sounds ideal. Where did you get it?"

Uh-oh. I didn't want to expose Grandma and Grandpa. "Uh, Dr. Bunyan prescribed it."

"Did someone mention my name?" Dr. Bunyan asked as he came in.

Uh-oh.

"Summer says you wrote her a prescription."

"Of course. How's the ointment working out?"

"Couldn't be better." Whew.

"Well," Dr. Phillips said, "I'm sorry that the pills didn't help you, but I'm glad you've found something that works for you. I think, the next time I want to hear from you, I'll go to wherever you are."

"Okay. If I get too big for the house, my folks will tell you where I am."

"Sounds like a plan. Have a good day."

On my way out, I said to Dr. Bunyan, "Thanks for covering for me, Dr. Bunyan."

"It was nothing. I smelled the ointment, and I figured you might not want to alert the medical community."
11111111111111111112121.title: Dr. Phillips

111111111111111111121211.content:
We were at home, relaxing. Dad asked, "What do we want to do for supper tonight?"

Before anyone could answer, Sam fell off the couch, screaming.

Mom and I rushed to her. "What is it, baby?" Mom asked. "What's wrong?"

"D-don't know," Sam answered.

I thought the strain in her voice sounded familiar. I touched her, and I knew for certain. "She's growing."

Sure enough, Sam's body swelled from 5', 6", to 5', 9".

"We'd better take her to the ER," Dad said. "We'll take both cars, so Summer can come along."

That was a relief. I didn't think I could take waiting at home.

As we were getting ready to leave, the phone rang. Mom answered it. "Hello? Oh, hello, Ms. Swanson. I'm sorry, we can't stay to talk, Sam had a growth spurt, and we need to figure out why. No, I meant Sam. Alright, we'll see you there. 'Bye for now."

******************************


We got Sam in pretty quickly. Dr. Phillips ordered some blood tests. And now we had nothing to do but wait.

Mom asked Ms. Swanson, "What did you want to talk to us about?"

"I noticed that Summer has been looking tired lately," she replied. Turning to me, she asked, "Are you getting enough sleep, dear? Have the nightmares come back?"

"No," I answered. "I'm too big for the front seat of the car, so I have to get up early and walk to school."

"You're not too big for the front seat of my SUV," she said. "I'll drive you, if you'd like."

"Sounds good to me."

Dr. Phillips returned. "I'd like to speak with Sam privately, please."

We got up to leave, and I realized I'd had another growth spurt, bringing me up to an even seven feet tall.

We withdrew some distance away, so neither Ms. Swanson nor I could overhear.

After a few minutes, Dr. Phillips came to us. "You can come back."

As we went back into the exam room, Dr. Phillips said, "We've figured out what triggered Sam's growth."

Sam nodded. "I'm pregnant."
111111111111111111121211.title: At Home

1111111111111111111212111.content:
"His name is Brad," Sam continued. "Brad Williams. He... he told me he was dying, and I wanted to do something special for him, before... "

"And how is he?" Dad asked. The implication was that Brad's claim just might come to pass.

Sam looked down. "His family was just moving to New York. How could I have been so stupid?"

Mom hugged her. "You're 14," she said. "You're supposed to be a little naive. It's just bad luck that it had these consequences." Turning to Dr. Phillips, she asked, "How far along is she?"

"6 to 8 weeks, given what she told me. If you'd like, we can examine her, to be sure."

"Let's do that," Dad said.

******************************


Two hours later, we were leaving the hospital. "I'll call Grandma," Mom said, "let her know we'll need more ointment."

"You've got a decision to make, young lady," Dad said.

"I don't know what to do," Sam replied. "How can I take care of a little baby when I'm so big?"

"Maybe Grandpa can talk to you about that," Mom said.

We got into our cars and went home.
1111111111111111111212111.title: Continue

choices: I move in with grandma and grandpa.
11111111111111111112121111.content:
After a quick call, we took Sam to see Grandma and Grandpa. They welcomed her with open arms. "You are not the first girl to be duped by that old line." Serious, Grandpa said. "You certainly will not be the last."

"I do want to keep the baby." Softly, Sam said. "He or she did not ask to come into this world..."

"That's a good start." Calmly, Grandma said. "I strongly suggest you do not allow this Brad Williams any part of your child's future. I will introduce you to the family attorney later."

Grandpa nodded. "Now that the depressing part of the visit is over, let's move on to better and brighter business." Calmly, he said. "My wife has more of that ointment you will both need for your growth spurts, and we have plenty of room for a second guest, if it comes to that."

"I could use a little help around the house." smiling, Grandma said. "Your grandfather still has quite the appetite." She winked at Sam. "Your appetite will grow with you, my dear."

Sam winced. "What if...."

"I know what you are about to ask, sweetie." smiling, Grandpa said. "What if I hurt the baby... what if he or she becomes afraid of me..." He chuckled. "We come from a very long line of tough customers, it will take a lot to harm your child. Second, he or she will grow up seeing you as however tall you will become, and find it natural."

"It would be a different story if your child was adopted." Serious, Grandma added. "However, in this case, you have nothing to dread, my dear."

Sam breathed a slight sigh of relief, though she was still worried. Grandpa chuckled, seeing it. "There are a lot of giants in your family, Sam." Kindly, he said. "I'll give a few a call, and maybe one will pay you a visit."

"Normally, we tend to stay out of the spotlight." Grinning, Grandma said. "Too much attention can be a bad thing."

"Enough about that." Smiling, Grandpa said. He motioned to Sam. "We have something to celebrate, so let's celebrate already."

Sam smiled slightly at that, tears forming. "I have the coolest family..."

"Hear, hear." Smiling, I said.
11111111111111111112121111.title: Visiting Grandma and Grandpa

111111111111111111121211112.content:
A knock on the door signaled the arrival of a relative. Specifically, how high up on the door the person knocked signaled that it was a relative.

Grandma opened the door, and in came a 20-foot-tall woman. "Good to see you again, Marge," the giantess said. "Where are the little ones?"

"Right this way, June," Grandma said. "One in particular could use your help, she's got a baby on the way."

"Lead me to them."

Great-Aunt June walked right up to me. "How you doing, darling? You the one in the family way?"

"That's me," Sam said. "I don't want an abortion, but I'm afraid I might hurt the baby when it's born."

"Well, I'm glad for the baby's sake that you aren't thinking of giving it up. Why, just imagine the fix you and your sisters would be in if your father had been adopted. Doctors wouldn't want to quit studying you until they knew everything about you."

I nodded. "I spent two days under medical observation. I wouldn't wish it on Kyle or Brad, let alone a child."

"Bring us an egg, would you, Marge?" Great-Aunt June said.

When Grandma brought the egg, Great-Aunt June took it and handed it to Sam. "If you can hold an egg without crushing it, you'll know you can hold a baby without hurting it."

Sam took the egg. It didn't break. For the first time since finding out she was pregnant, Sam looked relieved.
111111111111111111121211112.title: A giant relative visits.

1111111111111111111212111121.content:
Three days later, Ms. Swanson was driving me home. "Sam had a growth spurt in my class today," she said.

"Good thing she had a bigger outfit in her locker," I replied.

"How is she taking everything?"

"She's getting better. She knows she's got family who will help her with both her growth and her baby."

"Speaking of growth, how long will it be before you need to relocate?"

"Mom and Dad say I can stay until I'm 8 feet tall. That's when I need to start avoiding light fixtures. So, at the rate I'm growing, I should have another week."

"Mm. Likewise, I'd say that school won't become too small for you until you're 9 feet tall. Start planning."

We arrived at my house. I thanked Ms. Swanson for the ride and went inside.

As soon as I closed the door, I had a growth spurt. However, this one was bigger than previous spurts had been. My clothes were a wreck.

I went straight to my room and measured myself. "Seven and a half feet!" I cried.

I double-checked it. The figure hadn't changed.

I was reeling. That meant I would be too big for the house in three days, not nine. And I would be too big for school in nine days, instead of three weeks.

I called Grandma and Grandpa, to let them know I would be moving in sooner than anticipated. "Oh, dear," Grandma said. "With that rate of growth, I'd say you can definitely count on being taller than Grandpa, when you stop growing."

Taller than Grandpa. I sat down on the floor. I knew that wouldn't collapse under my giant posterior.
1111111111111111111212111121.title: My Growth Rate Picks Up

choices: Driving around in my new truck.
11111111111111111112121111211.content:
I called for Mom, a bit more loudly than I had intended, due to my new size. Mom came running, and sighed upon seeing my new height. "It looks like you'll be living with Grandma and Grandpa sooner than expected." Softly, she said. "Though you might want to tone your voice down a bit."

"Sorry, Mom." Wincing, I said.

Mom smiled. "There is nothing to be sorry about, dear." Patiently, she replied. "I'll help you pack."

"I'm leaving now?" Surprised, I asked.

Mom nodded. "It's best to get you into a bigger house now, before you can't get out of this one." Serious, she said. "After we pack, I will call Grandpa to pick you up."

Another surprise. "Grandpa has a car that fits him?!"

Mom giggled. "It's a custom built vehicle." Bemused, she replied. "His brothers built it for him from scratch; just wait until you see it..."

I have to admit, I was crying as I packed my belongings. Mom, Dad, Becca, and Sam all cried with me here and there, as we hugged each other more than a few times, as we filled my bags to leave the house. "Will you visit me here and there?" Tearfully, I asked.

"Of course, we will." With a tearful smile, Mom said. "I'll also call you every night."

"I'll likely be with you in a few weeks." Tearfully, Sam added. "With a little one on the way."

Minutes later, we heard a loud horn outside. I peered through the window to receive another surprise. There was a huge silver truck in the road in front of my house! It looked like it had come straight out of a science fiction novel. The cab was five times bigger than any pickup truck I had ever seen, and it was a four door. The wheels were enormous, and it had a hitch in the back for a camper, which i could only imagine what it looked like. Mom and I walked out, with luggage in hand, where Grandpa stepped out to greet us. I giggled seeing the license plate, Big Boy.

"Do you like her?" Smiling, Grandpa asked.

"She's beautiful." Smiling, I replied.

Grandpa grinned before tossing me the keys.... another surprise. "You- You want me to drive?!"

"You have your license, don't you?" Still smiling, Grandpa countered.

I nodded. "Well, yes..."

"Then the truck is all yours, for as long as you can fit in it." Smiling, Grandpa said. "You need a way to get around without having to cram yourself into tight places."

I teared up and hugged Grandpa before he helped load the back seat with the luggage. After giving everyone one last hug goodbye, I got behind the wheel of the big pickup. There was plenty of room, in fact, I had to adjust the seat to reach the pedals. "I thought I would never drive again." Softly, I said.

Grandpa laughed. "You should see my brother's truck."

With that, I drove the truck away from home to Grandma and Grandpa's.
11111111111111111112121111211.title: Telling the Family

111111111111111111121211112111.content:
Once we got to my new (temporary, a little voice inside me said) home, Grandpa and I unloaded my things and brought them into my room. It was huge. The bed itself was as big as my bedroom back at my parents' house had been. I gave it a try. It felt good to have a bed where my feet didn't dangle off the end. Yet.

The first person I called was Ms. Swanson. "You don't need to drive me to and from school anymore," I said. "My grandpa's letting me drive his pickup for as long as I fit."

"You get to drive the Big Boy? Congratulations," she said. "I guess this means you had to move out sooner than you expected?"

"Yeah. I grew six inches instead of three. Grandma says I'll be one of the taller members of the family. I'll start making my goodbyes at school tomorrow. And I'll drive Sam when she can't fit in the car anymore."

I put my things away just in time for one of Grandpa's typically hearty suppers, then worked on my homework until Mom called.

"How's it feel," Mom asked, "not calling this house home anymore?"

"I'm settling in here pretty well," I replied. "I fit here, at least for now. The bed fits me."

"Sounds like you needed this more than you realized. Hold on, someone else wants to say hello."

"Hey, Summer," Sam said.

"Hey, Sam, how are you?"

"I already miss you, big sister. We all do."

"Not as much as I miss you guys. Hey, let me know when Mom says you can't ride in the car anymore. I'll drive you until the Big Boy isn't big enough for me."
111111111111111111121211112111.title: Moving in.

1111111111111111111212111121111.content:
I hadn't made any really good friends at Pierce High, but there were those who I kind of liked. Sure, most of them were teachers, but a few weren't. And, whoever they were, I wished that I didn't have to say goodbye to them. But I wasn't going to stop growing yet, and the school would soon be too small for me. Even now, my shoulders touched the frame and the door when I ducked to get through.

I decided to make today my last day of school. Getting stuck here would be just as bad as getting stuck at Mom and Dad's house.

"What will you do after today?" the principal asked.

"I don't know," I replied. "I'll help my grandmother around the house. I've got the Big Boy for a while. Ultimately, I know there's a place where I'll fit. I don't know where it is, or how big I'll be when I get there, but it's out there."

"Take care of yourself, Summer."

I smiled. "I'm a big girl, sir."

With that, I climbed into the Big Boy, turned the key, and left Pierce High for the last time. I would only return to drop off or pick up Sam. The student part of my life was officially over.
1111111111111111111212111121111.title: Saying Goodbye

11111111111111111112121111211111.content:
An odd feeling, leaving high school behind before graduation. Wherever I looked, I saw possibilities. I decided to do some exploring in the Big Boy.

However, as I checked out the first places that came to mind, I realized that those possibilities were either closed, or would be soon. All the places that represented freedom to me before the accident would no longer contain me for long. I would be 8 feet tall in just a couple of days: if that was too big for school, or for Mom and Dad's house, it would be too big for the mall.

I found a fast food joint whose drive-thru had no height restrictions on vehicles. I ordered a dozen of the biggest sandwiches they had to offer, along with a dozen large beverages. After paying for and getting them, I drove to a park and made a sort of picnic of it. I took off my shoes, and let my toes play in the grass.

A little girl, maybe about 4 or 5, came up to me. "You're a big lady," she said.

"I am, indeed," I replied.

"How'd you get so big?"

"I come from a big family. Wanna know a secret?"

She nodded.

I leaned in close. "I'm still growing."

Her eyes went wide after I relayed this information.

"Ashley!" said a woman who could only have been the girl's mother. "Leave the lady be, she might... " She stopped talking as she took in my size.

"Could I get that big?" Ashley asked.

"It's possible. You've got to eat everything your folks tell you to, though."

"Darn," Ashley said, then went back to her mom.

As they walked away, Ashley waved goodbye to me. So did her mother, if a little hesitantly at first.

Finishing my picnic lunch, I threw away the trash and got back into the Big Boy. As I drove back to my new home, I idly wondered if maybe Ashley might turn out to have the giant gene, after all.
11111111111111111112121111211111.title: Driving

111111111111111111121211112111111.content:
On Friday night, Mom, Dad, and my sisters came over to spend the weekend. It had been three days since I moved out, but Dad was still surprised by my 8-foot height.

Sam was up to 6', 3", and seemed to be feeling a little better about her size. Becca was just glad to see her big sister again. I took a knee so I could hug them both.

Grandpa and I cooked up a nice, big supper, and everyone dug in.

"How are you and the baby doing, Sam?" Grandma asked.

"I think we're okay," Sam replied. "But the funny thing is, I've always heard about pregnant women having morning sickness, but I haven't had any."

"There are a couple of different explanations for that," Grandma said. "One is, not all mothers-to-be get morning sickness. Try to act miserable, so the rest don't get jealous."

"The other explanation," Grandpa added, "is that your body needs all that protein. You're not just growing a baby, you're growing yourself."

******************************


After supper, I showed Sam and Becca my bedroom. They were amazed at the size of my bed. I was still at a size where, if we wanted, all three of us could have slept on it.
111111111111111111121211112111111.title: The Family Visits

1111111111111111111212111121111111.content:
"I don't see why you wanted the two of us to have a picnic," Sam said, as we laid out the food we brought.

"C'mon, it'll be fun," I replied. "Besides, there may be somebody here who you'd like to meet."

We were about halfway through the picnic when I heard the voice I'd been waiting for: "Whoa, you really did get bigger!"

"Told you. Sam, this little fan of big ladies is Ashley, and the very concerned woman with her is her mother, Cathy. Ladies, this is my little sister, Sam."

"How do you do?" Cathy said. Then, turning to me, she asked, "Are you sure you're okay? Growing like you are,... I don't see how that can be healthy."

"I'm seeing the best doctor in the state," I replied. "He says I'm perfectly healthy. Just big, and getting bigger."

Ashley turned to Sam. "Are you gonna be big, too?"

"Yes, I am."

"Cool."

Sam turned to Cathy. "Can I pick her up?"

Cathy thought about it for a moment, then gave her permission.

Sam scooped up Ashley and spun her around. They both enjoyed it

"See?" I asked. "If this little girl loves the sight of you, just imagine how your own baby will feel."
1111111111111111111212111121111111.title: The Next Day

11111111111111111112121111211111111.content:
"Your baby?" Cathy asked. "You're pregnant?"

Sam nodded. "Two months. I've been stressing over how my baby is going to look at me."

"All mothers are bigger than their babies," Cathy said. "If you show your baby love, love is how they'll see you." She paused. "If I may ask, what's childbirth like for... people like you?"

Sam smiled. "You can say giants. It's the word. According to my great-aunt, pregnancy and childbirth are much like they are for women your size. The difference is, we're attended by midwives instead of doctors, and the birth takes place in a barn-like structure. We don't fit into hospitals that well."

"I guess not."

******************************


When we got home, I decided to unwind in my room before it was time to help Grandpa fix supper. When I opened my bedroom door, there was Becca, looking in the mirror, standing on a chair, holding one of my outfits up like she was wearing it. "This is a change," I said.

Becca dropped the dress.

I picked it up and hung it back up. "Wanna talk about it?"

She sighed. "I don't want to be the short one. I don't want to be called half-pint."

"Becca," I said, hugging her, "we all grow at our own pace, to our own size. You're twelve. Growth spurts will come for you, like they do for everyone. I don't know how tall you'll be. But I know that this thing in here," - I touched her chest - "is ginormous."
11111111111111111112121111211111111.title: Continue

choices: Grandma Joins Me on a Picnic
111111111111111111121211112111111111.content:
A couple days later, after my folks and my sisters went back home, I was doing my daily household chores with Grandma. "It's a nice day out today," Grandma said. "Will you be having another picnic in the park after we're done?"

"Not today, Grandma," I replied. "Today, I'm due for another growth spurt. I could get in trouble if I ripped through my dress while I was out and about."

"Oh, that's right. Well, perhaps after that, then? I'd like to join you, if I may."

"Tomorrow, definitely, Grandma. Weather permitting."

"I've heard you've made some friends on your excursions?"

"There's a little girl named Ashley, and her mother, Cathy. Ashley just loves the fact that I'm growing so much, and Cathy... well, she's easing her way to accepting me. They've met Sam, so, no matter how big I end up getting, she's got people to talk to."

"Do you mean Sam, or this Cathy woman?"

I thought about that. "Yes."

******************************


After lunch, we were watching TV, when it happened. Thanks to the ointment, I didn't feel a thing during my growth spurts anymore, so my first indication was the tearing of my dress at the seams. During the commercial break, I went to my room and put on the next size up. I was up to eight and a half feet.

As I sat back down, I asked Grandpa, "What happens when I get too big for your house?"

"We've got a piece of property," Grandpa replied, "that should hold you over for a good while. But don't worry too much about it, Summer. You'll be over 25 feet tall before that happens."

Previously, the thought of how much I would be growing made me faint. Now, though, as I grew, I was able to focus on the plan for where I would go.

Of course, there was the teensy tiny little matter of what I was going to wear, and where I'd find enough food to sustain myself. But, I knew, others in my family had faced these challenges. I would simply do what they had done.
111111111111111111121211112111111111.title: My Next Growth Spurt

1111111111111111111212111121111111111.content:
The next day, Grandma came with me to the park. In deference to her decreased ability to get up off the ground, I picked a picnic table for our spot. It wasn't far from my usual spot, so it wouldn't be hard for Cathy and Ashley to spot us.

Sure enough, we had just started when they came upon us. Cathy walked right up to Grandma. "Pleased to meet you," she said. "It's nice to meet someone who doesn't make me strain my neck to talk to them."

Grandma chuckled. "Yes," she said, "I suppose my granddaughters are a bit to take in. I'm Marge."

"Cathy. That's my daughter, Ashley. Sorry if I offended you."

"None taken, I assure you. I had the same reaction when I met my husband's family. Twelve and a half feet tall, and he was the shortest one. Of course, Summer's poised to take after the tall ones."

As Grandma and Cathy talked, I began to notice that I was getting attention from more than just Ashley. I had no problem being as tall as I was, nor with growing even taller, but I was beginning to sympathize with Grandpa, who hid from the stares.
1111111111111111111212111121111111111.title: Grandma Joins Me on a Picnic

11111111111111111112121111211111111111.content:
A little less than a week later, I pulled up to Mom and Dad's house, right after breakfast at Grandma and Grandpa's. "Cutting it a little close, don't you think?" Sam asked, as she climbed into the Big Boy.

"Sorry," I replied. "It takes a lot of food to fill me up, as you will see." I was nine and a half feet tall, and Sam was six-nine.

As we drove, I asked, "How's school going?"

"It's going," she replied, "in more than one sense. Everybody knows I'll soon be too big to come anymore."

"And the baby?"

"Dr. Bunyan says I'm right where I should be. Most pregnant girls my age are at risk for low birth weight babies. Of course, that won't be a problem for me."

"How about your friends?"

"I'm doing okay, Mom," she said.

"Sorry. It's just, you're the only person I know, other than me, who's going through this right now. I want to know that you're alright. Should I not care about how my little sister is doing?"

"Don't let Becca know you called me that."

"I know. Last weekend, I caught her in my bedroom again. She likes to fantasize about becoming a giantess herself."

"She's grown another inch. You'd swear nobody ever made it to five-foot-two before."

"Let her have her fun, she's not hurting anybody." I pulled up to the drop-off. "I'll pick you up at three. See you then."

"See you. And thanks." With that, she climbed out and joined her friends.
11111111111111111112121111211111111111.title: I Start Driving Sam

111111111111111111121211112111111111111.content:
When I got up to 10 feet tall, I found a surprise in my clothes for that size.

Let me explain: About a year before, I heard someone say that people who were a little shorter than average could make themselves look taller by wearing smaller clothes. Supposedly, it would create an optical illusion that others would interpret as you being taller. Well, I tried it, with a belly shirt and a thigh-high skirt, and I didn't even dare to leave the house. I thought I looked like a little kid who decided to put on her slutty sister's clothes for a giggle.

So imagine my surprise when, among my clothes for when I was twice as tall as when I made that experiment, I found a belly shirt and a thigh-high skirt.

Well, I tried them on, and, to my surprise, I felt comfortable in them.

I mentioned this to Grandma, and she said, "Well, Summer, there are those girls in your grandfather's family who, as they grew, felt more comfortable wearing proportionally less clothing. It looks like you're taking after them."

So, the bigger I got, the less of me that I would want covered up. I thought of the movie, Attack of the 50 Foot Woman, where the title character went from wearing full-length dresses at her normal height to wearing almost a bed sheet bikini when it was time for the titular attack. "Do they ever get so big that they just say 'Forget it' and walk around in their birthday suits?"

"A few of them do, yes," Grandpa replied.
111111111111111111121211112111111111111.title: Ten Feet Tall

1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.content:
I decided to take a walk in the park with Grandpa. "I still love taking walks out here." Smiling, he said. "I don't have to worry about bumping my head, as the branches are cut high, to dissuade children from climbing the trees."

I giggled at that, before meeting up with Cathy and Ashley. With them was one of Ashley's friends from school, a small boy named Joey, who seemed upset over a balloon that had gotten away from him and was in one of the trees. As we approached, Joey looked at my grandfather and me in surprise. "Fee Fie Foe Fum..." Startled, he muttered.

Grandpa chuckled. "That's just a fairy tale." With a dismissive wave of his hand, he said. "It's actually part of an old giant drinking song."

"A drinking song?" Confused, Ashley asked.

Grandpa nodded then sang, Fee Fie Foe Fum, He Hi Ho Hum, ring the bells and bang your own drum! He Hi Ho Hum, Fee Fie Foe Fum, feast and be merry with friendship and rum...

Before long, he had Joey, Ashley, Cathy and even me singing along with him. It was a fun and catchy tune that made me feel good inside. When we had stopped singing, Joey smiled up at Grandpa and me with stars in his eyes. "I hope I grow up to be a giant." Dreamily, he said.

"Men are not judged by how tall they are." Smiling, Grandpa said. "They are judged by how many times they kneel to help a child."

With that, he keeled down and gently lifted Joey high enough to grab his lost balloon. Joey was smiling ear to ear as Grandpa put him back down. Not only for getting his balloon back, for being picked up by a real giant. "It must be awesome to be a giant!" Happily, he said.

Grandpa sighed. "It has some advantages." Softly, he said.

I placed a gentle hand onto his shoulder, knowing he was short among his family of giants. "You are the greatest giant in my book, Grandpa." Smiling, I said.

Grandpa smiled, a tear forming. "Thank you, pumpkin." Hugging me, he said. "That means more than you realize."

"I see you had a change in fashion sense." Smiling, Cathy said. "Trying to attract a certain giant boy we haven't met yet?"

I blushed at that, while grandpa laughed. "If she is, I haven't met him yet, either." Nudging me, he teased. "I guess we will have to wait..."

"Grandpa..." Blushing, I protested.

"We better move along before we embarrass her further." Smiling, Cathy said. "It was nice to meet you, sir."

"Likewise, my dear." Smiling back, Grandpa said.

With that, Grandpa and I finished our walk in the park where, to my surprise, we saw Mom...
1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.title: Walk in the park.

1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.content:
There were two of them, and they were a good fifty or sixty feet away. Which would have been daunting to five-foot-tall me, or to Cathy, but was only a short sprint to me now. I ran straight for them.

One of them either saw me or heard me coming, but the other one had his back turned. Neither one had time to react, however, before I picked them both up off their feet. "Well, well, well," I said. "Looks like somebody didn't get the memo: This park, and the good people in it, are under the protection of giants."

One of them looked at the other as if there actually were a local ordinance to that effect.

"Now," I continued, "you bad little boys can apologize to the nice lady, and give her back everything you took from her, or you can learn whether or not you two can fly. The choice is yours."

Wisely, they chose Option 1, and were most sincere in their apologies. Once Mom picked up her things, I put the muggers down, and they ran off, hopefully to rethink their career choices.

"Are you okay, Mom?"

"A little banged up," she replied, "but nothing's broken." She took in my clothes. "Haven't seen that look in a while. Do you still need to look taller?"

"Well, don't criticize her clothes too much," Grandpa said, having caught up to us. "They've got a little more give. Perfect for the occasional stress-induced early growth spurt."

I looked down. Sure enough, the hem of my skirt had migrated six inches up my thigh.

I turned to Grandpa. "Guess it won't be long before I'm too big for the Big Boy."

"Don't worry," he said, "the Big Boy can take a driver up to 25 feet, just like the house. You won't be giving me back the keys for a good while yet."
1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.title: being mugged!

1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.content:
Mom didn't need medical attention, but she got plenty of attention from Grandma. A bag of frozen peas for her swollen face, and a bowl of her famous chicken soup for her soul, put her right with the world.

By this time, it was almost time for me to pick up Sam at school, so Mom got to ride along in the Big Boy. Along the way, I called Sam. "When you climb in," I told her, "remember to keep calm. Turns out that stress is just as good as sex at triggering early growth spurts."

"Glad you waited until I wasn't stressed out by growth spurts to tell me that," she replied.

When Sam got in, Mom was the first thing she saw. "What happened to you?"

"It looks worse than it is," she answered. "I ran into a couple of muggers in the park. Luckily, your big sister was there, and she sent them off looking for clean pants."

Sam breathed a sigh of relief. "I'm just glad you're okay, Mom." Turning her attention to me, she asked, "What, two growth spurts in one day?"

"Remember what I said about stress? Can you think of a more stressful situation than watching your mom get mugged?"

"Good point. What's next?"

"For today, I take you both home, then I go back to Grandma and Grandpa's, and we all enjoy some good food. Tomorrow, if Mom wants to go back to the park, I know some people she'll be glad to meet, and vice versa."
1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.title: Bringing Mom Home

1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.content:
"Your father was quite shocked when I told him what you're wearing now," Mom said, as she, Grandpa, and I settled in at my favorite picnic spot.

"He was?" I replied. Turning to Grandpa, I said, "Guess we shouldn't tell him about the ones so tall that they don't wear anything at all."

"No, I think we should," he replied. "For all we know, you just might grow to be that tall."

"Dad, please tell me you're kidding."

"I never joke about people bigger than I am. You know this about me."

Luckily for Mom, it wasn't long before Cathy, Ashley, and Joey came along. Joey was joined by two women, presumably his mothers, and presumably checking on his stories about giants. Cathy took one look at Mom and came running. "Oh, dear me," she said.

"You should see the other guy," Mom told her.

"This wasn't a... domestic situation, was it?"

"Certainly not," Grandpa said. "My wife and I raised our boy better than that. She was assaulted by strangers yesterday. You can tell they were strangers, because anyone who knows her knows not to make two of her daughters angry."

"Now that that's been settled," I said, "I think introductions are in order. Everyone, this is my mother. Mom, this is Cathy; her giant-loving daughter, Ashley; Ashley's good friend, and a fan of giants in his own right, Joey; and two ladies who I will allow to introduce themselves, as I'm just meeting them today, myself."

"I'm Holly," said one, "and this is Melodie. Joey is our son." Looking me up and down, she said, "When Joey said he met a couple of giants, I figured he must have meant some unusually tall people. I never expected... "

"You've got nothing to worry about," Cathy said. "Summer, here, actually talked Ashley into eating her vegetables."

"It's true, my boy," Grandpa said. "I eat my vegetables every day. Except for cauliflower, I never liked that."

Before too long, we were all sitting and talking. And eating, as Grandpa had overestimated how much Mom could eat on her own.
1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.title: Back to the Park

1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.content:
On Friday night, the family came over, like always. Unlike always, they brought all of Sam's things. "She didn't hit seven and a half feet this last growth spurt," Mom said, "but she's sure to with the next one."

"How come Summer grew faster than I did?" Sam asked.

"Don't worry too much about it," Grandpa replied. "It just means you won't be one of the bigger members of the family. That's all."

After supper, I helped Sam unpack and settle into her new home. "How are you doing?" I asked.

"I already miss all my friends at school," she answered. "And I miss the house. And Sunday night's gonna suck. But what am I gonna do? Not growing isn't an option. At least I've got Grandma and Grandpa. And you, for at least a while. Think I'll get big enough to want a belly shirt 24/7?"

"Hard to say. Speaking of bellies,... "

Sam patted her belly, which was still perfectly flat. "Dr. Bunyan says I'm right where a two months pregnant giantess ought to be. He says my breasts should get bigger any day now. Is it weird that I'm looking forward to all the changes being pregnant will bring?"

"No weirder than looking forward to all the changes being a giant will bring. And, if that's weird, who wants to be normal?"
1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.title: Sam Moves In

1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.content:
"Any day now" turned out to be the very next morning. Sam had definitely filled out. Of course, Grandma had a collection of bras that fit her.

After breakfast, and the washing of the breakfast dishes, the whole family decided to go for a picnic lunch in the park. It was the first time Dad and Becca had joined us on an outing.

It wasn't long before our favorite visitors came by. Ashley and Joey were thrilled to see the giant members of the family, of course, but they also said hello to Becca, not wanting her to feel left out. "Will you be a giant, too?" Joey asked her.

"I hope so," she replied.

"Me, too," he said. "I want to be a giant."

The parents and Grandma sat at a picnic table, talking about whatever, when Sam got everybody's attention with a growth spurt. Up she went to 7', 6". Her clothes ripped here and there, but didn't actually tear.

Then it was my turn, and I grew to 11', 6". My clothes didn't tear, but my skirt looked shorter than when I put it on.

"That's what happens when you dress like that," Dad said.

"For your information, Dad," I said, "among the larger giants, less clothing is more comfortable."

Dad gave me a funny look. "What?" I asked.

"You used to call me Daddy."

I kissed him on the forehead. "Guess I'm growing up, in more ways than one."
1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.title: Growth Spurts at the Park

1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.content:
The weeks went by quickly.

Grandma, Grandpa, and I took Sam to her three-month checkup. I was up to 15 feet tall, and Sam was at nine and a half feet. But she was still a 14-year-old girl, and her belly was starting to grow. The baby was taking after its mother. "I'm definitely going to be as big as a house!" she said.

Dr. Bunyan smeared gel over Sam's belly, then we listened for a minute to the baby's heartbeat. Then he turned on the ultrasound, and we got our first look at Sam's baby.

"It's amazing," I said.

"Can we tell if it's a boy or a girl?" Sam asked.

"Not yet," Dr. Bunyan said. "The genitals will develop over the next month, so you can spend that time making up your mind if you want to know before you give birth."

Dr. Bunyan printed up several pictures, so Sam could share it with Mom and Dad, Becca, and our friends at the park.
1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.title: The Next Milestone

1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.content:
We were relaxing at home when my next growth spurt hit.

I had gotten used to my clothes getting, at most, a little snug following my growth spurts, so imagine my surprise when I was suddenly nearly naked in my grandparents' living room.
