Repeating "I'm sorry" as if it would somehow cover me better than my clothes were, I went to my room and measured myself.

16 feet tall.

I had grown an entire foot in one growth spurt.

Digging through the clothes that Grandma had given me, I found a set that would fit me, then went back to the living room, and told everybody what had happened.

"No doubt about it, Summer," Grandpa said, "you're going to be a big one."

"You'll be okay, Summer," Sam said. "I know you will. And you know our family and friends all love you."

I knew that, and it was nice to hear.

But I kept thinking about the fact that, once I was 25 feet tall, I would be too big for the second place I called home.

And that day was now less than a month away.
1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.title: I Get Bigger Faster

1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.content:
Grandma could tell that I was worried. "Maybe we should go to that property we told you about," she said. "Once you see it, you'll feel better about what's happening, just like you felt better when you knew you'd be coming here."

"Capital idea, Mother," Grandpa said. "Everybody into the truck. I'll direct you."

I felt a little bit nervous when I saw we were going outside the city limits. I consoled myself, though, remembering that I would need plenty of room, if Grandpa was right.

We drove out to an old airstrip that was no longer being used. "About the only people who come out here," Grandpa said, "are movie people, and some young folks who liked to blow things up. You won't have to talk to anyone you don't want to." We identified ourselves to the man at the gate, and he waved us in.

I continued to follow Grandpa's directions, until we came to it. "This ought to be big enough for a good while," Grandpa said.

"Boy, that's for sure," Sam replied.

It was an old airplane hangar, and it was massive. "If I were 100 feet tall," I said, "I still couldn't touch the ceiling."

Funny thing I should use that measurement, because, off in a distant corner, there was a futon that was 100 feet long. Yes, I could see myself living there for several growth spurts.

"Fancy running into you all here!"

I turned at the familiar voice. "Cathy!" I couldn't resist picking her up and hugging her.

"I take it you all know each other?" asked the man from the gate.

"These are the people from the park," Cathy said, as I set her back down. "The giants who are so nice to Ashley."

"Cathy's my wife," he said. "The name's Kyle."

"That's an easy name for me to remember," I said.

"What brings you folks out here?" Cathy asked.

"I'll be outgrowing my grandparents' house in a few weeks," I answered. "When that happens, here is where I'll be."

"Well," Cathy said, "Kyle will tell me when you move in, and Ashley and I will come to see you when you're settled in."

"I'd like that." Already, the hangar was beginning to seem like home.
1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.title: Making Plans

1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.content:
A week later, it became clear that Sam's growth had reached a plateau at 10 feet. Dr. Bunyan said she might grow another foot or two, but that would be more gradual. For now, the most obvious growth associated with her would be her baby bump.

I, on the other hand, continued with my growth spurts. Twelve days after we saw the hangar, I was 20 feet tall, with no end in sight.

A few people pointed out to me that, as I grew, I seemed to be treating regular-sized people more like children, like when I picked Cathy up. I promised to watch myself on that. After all, it hadn't been so long ago that people treated me like I was a little girl, and I certainly didn't want to start treating people like playthings when I got even bigger.

At 21 feet, we began moving things into the hangar, mostly outfits for me to wear. Grandpa also arranged for food deliveries to begin once it was time. The chemical plant where my journey to gigantism began would send me large fruit and vegetable shipments. As for meat, Grandpa suggested I catch some sharks.
1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.title: Time Passes

1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.content:
The day finally arrived when I would have to move into the airplane hangar. Grandpa drove me through the gate to my new home, with my family and friends following in vehicles of their own. There, I was met with a surprise. It no longer looked like an airplane hangar, but an actual house! Grandpa chuckled as I stepped out of the truck with my jaw half open. "How...?"

"I gave my brothers a call." Smiling, Grandpa said. "They and their kids renovated the place into a real workable home for you." He motioned to the house. "Take a look at your new home."

With family and friends following, I first walked up onto an open patio by the front door, where I found furniture both my size and normal size for guests. Draped over the huge French doors was a banner that read: Welcome home. "It's beautiful..." Tearing up, I said.

"You haven't seen anything yet, pumpkin." Smiling, Grandpa said. "Step inside."

I pushed the French doors open and walked into a huge open concept living space, with a stadium-sized big screen television and massive furniture to accommodate my size. Further in was a giant kitchen with a stove that was actually my size! In even further, I spotted a door that led into a bedroom, which I assumed had an en suite. It was like a sequence in a dream. I felt... normal.

I turned to Grandpa, giving him a hug. "Thank you so much!" Crying, I said.

"Now don't you start." Lightly scolding, Grandpa said. "You'll get me started."

"How do you like it, Summer?" Startling me, a booming voice asked.

I turned to find my great uncles, Ron and Don. Both stood at a good fifty feet tall, towering over even me. "It's been a while since I had to look up to someone." Smiling, I said.

Don chuckled. "I have a feeling that won't last." Kindly, he said. "Your grandfather may not be the tallest of giants, but believe me,... he is among the strongest, he'll outlive us all."

Grandpa blushed slightly at that. "I do try not to brag..."

Everyone had a laugh at that before I took notice of a second living space above me, for family and friends who may come to visit. "You did all of this for me?" Tearing up again, I said.

"We giants stick together, kiddo." Roughing up my hair, Ron said. "Everything custom built by us and others like us, to lead a normal life."

"You would be surprised how much certain people would pay to have a giant as a bodyguard, or to help with heavy lifting at a construction site or lumber yard." Smiling, Don added. "That, and it does not take much persuasion to keep us a closely guarded secret."

"It's perfect!" Tears falling, I said. "Thank you, all of you!"

"Our pleasure, little lady." Kindly, Ron said.

I smiled at that. It had been a long time since anyone called me 'little'.
1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.title: The Day Arrives

1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.content:
Ashley and Joey were agog. "I never seen a real giant's house before," Joey said.

"Can we stay here?" Ashley asked her folks.

"This is Summer's home," Cathy replied. "Let's let her get settled in before we start inflicting houseguests on her."

And, with that, they all began to leave. Ron and Don were first out the door, followed by Joey and his moms. Ashley and her folks were next.

Mom, Dad, and Becca gave me hugs before leaving. Becca seemed overwhelmed by the size of my house. I think, for the first time since Sam started growing, she was glad that she wasn't as big as I was. She may still want to be a giant, I thought, but she's hoping for a height limit.

The last to go were the three most comfortable with the surroundings: Grandma, Grandpa, and Sam. "I want to hear all about this little one," I said, putting two fingers on her belly.

"Don't worry," she replied. "We're going to be coming here on weekends, now. It wouldn't be fair to leave you out, big sister."

Finally, they left, and I had the house to myself. "Wonder what I'll do first?" I asked myself.

After listening to how empty the place sounded with just me in it, I began to think about what Don had said. Maybe I should think about what I could do, besides grow.
1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.title: Settling in.

1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.content:
I gave Don a call. "Hello?"

"Hi, Don, it's Summer. I've been thinking about something you said when I moved into the house. Well, I'd like to get in on it. What kind of jobs are out there for someone who's 25 feet tall and still growing?"

"Well, there's work in construction and lumber," he said. "A giant can do the same things a crane can. Of course, you'll have to wear boots and gloves while working."

He had a point. I had been spending nearly as much time barefoot as in shoes. "Okay. What else?"

"You could work for search and rescue operations. There are situations where a helicopter would find it too dangerous, but you could climb in."

"Okay. Know of anything else?"

"Well, word's gotten out about the park that's protected by giants. Plenty of businesses want a security guard who can scare people into behaving."

"I never thought that would get me noticed."

"Speaking of notice, you could find work in advertising. They won't need special effects to make you look like a giant."

"Thanks, Don. These are great ideas. I'll sleep on this, and make my decision in the morning. 'Bye."
1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.title: Job Opportunities

choices: My First Day on the Job
1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.content:
After breakfast, I looked up Search and Rescue and gave them a call. "I would like to join the team."

"Well," the woman at the other end of the line said, "we're always looking for people to help us. How old are you?"

"17."

"That's rather young. Why don't you stay in school, and get in touch with us after you graduate?"

"I don't fit into a school."

"Oh, come now, I'm sure the cliques aren't that bad."

"You misunderstand me. I am physically unable to fit inside a school building. I'm 25 feet tall, and I'm still growing."

"You're what?!"

"I'm a giantess. I'm big, and I'm strong, and I want to help people. Surely there's something I can do?"

"Well,... You know the cliffs out by Old Town Road?"

"I have vivid memories of the location."

"Well, it's a big problem for us. Kids making rash decisions, kids driving recklessly, and the occasional adrenaline junkie who thinks he can climb them. And it's not easy for us to get there. Can you?"

"It's not far from my house. I'll pack a lunch and walk over there."
1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.title: Search and Rescue

1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.content:
As I walked up Old Town Road, I was struck by the beautiful view. No wonder kids choose this place for their first time, I thought.

Now, though, I knew that it could all go wrong.

Sure enough, as I approached the spot where I had lost my virginity to Kyle Dennis, I saw a girl who couldn't have been a day over 16. She was walking toward the safety barrier, looking down.

"Hi," I said.

She turned, not expecting anybody in particular. Then her eyes went wide, taking in all of me.

"Whatcha doing?"

For a long time, she was silent, as if questioning if she could possibly have heard me right. Then, she said, "Nothing."

"Oh. Well, I decided to have lunch up here. Since you're already here, you're welcome to join me."

Again, that uncomprehending look. Then, she stepped away from the cliff.

As I laid out my lunch, she came closer. "Are you real?" she asked.

"I better be," I replied, "or what am I doing eating so much? Have a seat. Help yourself, if you want. Builds bodies twelve ways, I heard."

She sniffed at the ham, then nibbled some of it.

"So," I asked, "why are you here?"

"I'm pregnant."

"Really? So's my younger sister. Four months along, now. You?"

"My mom's gonna kill me."

"That sounds harsh. Did she say that?"

"No... But she didn't want this for me."

"And my folks didn't want for my sister to get pregnant. But she did, and now they're all waiting for the big day together."

"They didn't kick her out?"

"Nope. Well, she doesn't live with them anymore, but that's because she grew too tall for the house. I can relate. It's okay, though, she lives with our grandparents now. Grandpa's got a big place. I lived there, myself, until I outgrew it, too. Don't worry, though, my sister's not going to be this big."

"Why are you telling me all this?"

"A good question. I used to hang out at the park in town, and I would talk to people there. Now, though, it's a little far away. So, I came here, and I saw you, so I guess I figured, Maybe I can re-create that here. How's it working?"

She laughed. "You are such a big dork."

"I have to be, don't I? Okay, maybe I don't have to be a dork, but I have to be a big one, right? My name's Summer."

"Alex."

"Glad to meet you, Alex. Glad you came away from the ledge, too. See, I didn't just happen to be here. I'm with Search and Rescue, and they needed someone who could get here easier than they could. How's my first day going?"

She was back to uncomprehending silence.

"Look," I said, "if somebody asked you yesterday, you'd have sworn there was no way you were going to meet a 25-foot-tall teenage girl. And you'd have been wrong. So maybe your mom won't really kill you. Maybe she won't even yell at you. Maybe she'll be a little sad that it happened this way, but she'll be glad you came to her about it. Like meeting a giantess, the only way to find out is if you're alive to do it."

She didn't say anything. She just picked up some food, took it to her car, and drove to town.

I think my first day started off well.
1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.title: My First Day on the Job

1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.content:
As I gathered up my picnic supplies, I heard the squeal of brakes, and the sound of a car crashing. I took off toward the sound, not caring if I triggered a growth spurt.

As I got closer, I could see a spot where it looked like a car had gone off the cliff. Looking down, I saw the car. I heard someone calling 911, so it looked like at least one person might not be seriously hurt.

Carefully, I climbed down, next to the car. "Hi," I said. "You guys okay?"

The guy riding shotgun said, "Send help soon. I thought I was okay, but I'm looking at this babe, and she's 30 feet tall."

"Only 25 feet tall, last I checked," I replied. "Summer Roberts. I'm with Search and Rescue? You, on the phone, are you hurt?"

"I... I don't think so."

"Okay. I'm going to hold out my hand, and you climb into it, okay?"

He did, and I lifted him to the edge of the cliff. "Now, as long as you're on the horn, ask them to walk me through rescuing your friend."

"He's unconscious, and bleeding from the head. Okay, they say he needs to be taken out of there gently, so have whatever you're going to use to lift him under his body."

I opened the driver's side door, and let him fall into my hand. "Okay."

"On the count of three, get him all the way on, as smoothly as possible."

On three, I pulled him all the way onto my hand. "So far, so good."

"Now, gently bring him up where the ground is flat."

I climbed back up. I could hear sirens approaching. "Okay," I said, "here come the others. I'll just sit tight until they're ready to take him off my hands."

An ambulance came, and so did a TV news crew. They were less interested in the fact that people had survived an accident, than in the giant woman who had just saved them. I politely answered a few questions, then left for home. When I got there, I found that the stress of the situation had actually put me through enough that I had shot up two whole feet.
1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.title: Reckless Youth

1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.content:
I was 28 feet tall when Grandma, Grandpa, and Sam were the first to arrive. "How's it going with Search and Rescue?" Grandpa asked.

"I like it," I replied. "It gives me a chance to help people."

Mom, Dad, and Becca were next. Becca was amazed all over again. "I can't get over how big everything is," she said.

"And all the furnishings and appliances can be replaced when I outgrow them," I said.

As we ate, Dad said, "I still can't get over the way you dress, Summer. Your mother wore more when she was your age."

"Mom isn't a giantess, Dad. This is more comfortable for me than a whole dress would be."

"It's still a shock to see my daughter dressed like that."

"I'll let you in on a secret, Dad: there is a point where giants feel more comfortable wearing nothing at all."

Dad turned white at the thought. "Will... Will you get that big?"

"I honestly don't know, Dad."
1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.title: First Visit from the Family

choices: I've Got More Growing to Do
1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.content:
The days moved ahead.

Once I hit 30 feet tall, my growth spurts increased to two feet at a time.

At 40 feet, I began wearing bikinis.

At 50 feet, my next growth spurt didn't come after three days, or when I exerted myself (or, at least, what would've been exerting myself when I was smaller). I began to wonder if I had reached my maximum height.

Clearly, a visit to Dr. Bunyan was in order.
1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.title: Skipping Ahead

1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.content:
"Well, Summer," Dr. Bunyan said, "the results are in: you've stopped growing."

I had stopped growing. This was the second time I had been told this.

"How do you feel about it?" he asked.

"I guess I have mixed feelings about it," I replied. "On the one hand, you'd think being ten times my original size would be enough. On the other hand, part of me was looking forward to getting even bigger."

"Well, one point in favor of your growth stopping would have to be that you're done getting furniture and appliances. It can't be easy keeping up with growth spurts."

"I suppose not. And I'm already five times the size of Sam. Any bigger, and she might not let me hold my niece or nephew."

******************************


When I got home, the first call I made was to Grandma and Grandpa's. Grandma answered. "Hello?"

"Hi, Grandma, it's Summer. I just got back from Dr. Bunyan's office."

"And?"

"I won't be needing any more ointment. I've maxed out at 50 feet."

"Well, that sounds like good news."

"Yeah, I'd say that the benefits of not growing anymore outweigh my curiosity about what being even bigger would be like. What's new on your end? How's Sam doing?"

"Sam's doing just fine. She felt the baby move."

"Outstanding. That's another reason to look forward to our weekend get-together."

My next call was to Mom and Dad's. Dad would certainly be relieved to hear that I wouldn't get so big that I no longer wanted to wear anything, and Becca was jazzed because she was up to 5', 3".
1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.title: 50 Feet Is My Max

1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.content:
Some people who are always welcome at my house are Ashley, Joey, and their parents. The parents get nervous if Ashley or Joey ask me to pick them up: luckily, there's an elevator to the upper level where house guests sleep, and that's good enough for them. "How big are you going to get?" asked Holly, one of Joey's moms.

"This is it," I replied. "I stopped growing at 50 feet."

"That's got to make life easier for you," said Melodie, Joey's other mom.

"Yeah," I said. "Now I can trade in my 100-foot futon for a bed fit for a 50-foot-tall queen."

******************************


Later, Cathy, Ashley's mom, stepped into the bathroom, and she found me in there. "Oh, sorry," she said, "I didn't mean to intrude."

"Don't be silly," I said. "I haven't got anything you haven't seen before, I've just got more of it."

She went to the guest's toilet and assumed the position. "I suppose it shouldn't come as a shock that you have to... go... what with how much you eat and all."

"Actually, my appetite has decreased the last few days. Probably because I'm not growing anymore. But I've still got a big tummy, and it still needs to be filled. Which means other parts of my system need to be emptied."

"How about... other things?"

I chuckled. "If you're referring to the dam bursting, that's a box of my tampons next to you."

She looked. "Oh, goodness, I thought that was a wall."
1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.title: My Little Friends

I'll Try a Normal Sized Girl
1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.content:
"You can't feel anything yet, silly," Sam told me. "It's just for me right now."

"You can't blame an auntie for trying," I replied, taking my finger off her belly.

The finishing touches had been put on my house, and the family came to check it out. "It's a lovely home, Summer," Mom said. "It's a lot like what I pictured for you when you were a little girl."

"Thanks."

"You don't sound convinced of that," Grandpa said.

"I don't know," I said with a sigh. "I know it's a nice place. But, for some reason, I look around, and I feel like something's missing."

"I think I know what," Dad said. "You've always told us about your work in Search and Rescue, and I've noticed a pattern: You tend to invite whoever you're rescuing to share your lunch. It's a great strategy for convincing suicidal people that someone cares, but you do it with everyone."

"Are you saying... ?"

"You're lonely, Summer. You're not looking for comfort, or for personal fulfillment. You want someone to share it with."

"So what can I do? It's not like I can hit the dating scene."

"We know some people," Grandma said. "We just need to know two things: Would you prefer a boy or a girl? And would you prefer a giant, or someone my size?"
1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.title: The Family Visits

1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.content:
"You found love with Grandma, Grandpa," I said. "Maybe I can find it with someone her size."

"That's the spirit, Summer," Grandma said. "I'll make some calls, and we'll see what happens."

******************************


Saturday morning, I got a call. "Summer Roberts?"

"Speaking."

"My name is Jason Finnegan. My grandmother said you would be interested in a date?"

"I would, indeed. When were you thinking?"

"How about tonight, say, 8:00?"

"That sounds good.I live in the big house on the decommissioned airfield. I'll tell security that I'm expecting you. Goodbye for now."

After hanging up, I turned to Grandma. "So, what can you tell me about him? What's he like?"

"He's a charming young man, Summer. He's just a little insecure: he's the only one my size, out of a family of giants."
1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.title: I'll Try a Normal Sized Boy

1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.content:
As we both learned, dating between a giant and a person of average size has its challenges.

Take meals, for instance. A fancy restaurant would be a dream date for most girls, but there was no way they made enough food to fill my tummy. An all-you-can-eat buffet could certainly feed me, but it seemed cruel to the owners. Besides, where would I sit? Mr. Franklin and his identical brothers might smooth some things over, but they can't make a place accommodate Hugh Jass, if you know what I mean.

Then, inspiration struck Jason. He told me to take him to a supermarket, where he emerged with several shopping bags. Then, he directed me to the beach. It turned out that he had bought every rotisserie chicken they had, along with half the deli selection, so that was what we ate.

As we ate, we talked. "It's rough being the smallest of a family of giants," he said. "I spent so much time wishing I would grow, until I finally gave up."

"I know what you mean," I replied. "Up until a few months ago, I was only five feet tall. Then an accident triggered my dormant giantess genes, and here I am."

It turned out that Jason and I had a lot in common. We sat and talked for hours, until he happened to look at his watch. I brought him back to my home, where we kissed goodnight, before I set him back down next to his car. I waved as he drove away, then went inside.

Mom and Dad were waiting up for me. "How did it go?" Mom asked.

"I think it went well," I replied. I didn't know where we would go from here, but I was looking forward to finding out.
1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.title: My Date with Jason

1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.content:
Jason called me early the next day, sounding frightened and excited at the same time. "It happened!" Almost screaming into the phone, he cheered. "I thought it would never come, but it happened as I slept last night! It had to have been being with you, Summer! You are an angel!"

"Whoa, slow down!" Scolding, I said. "What happened?!"

"I grew five feet last night!" Tearfully, Jason cheered. "It hurts, I mean it really hurts, but I grew five feet!"

I smiled at that, knowing how much it meant to Jason to finally have growth spurts, though I could not see how being with me had anything to do with it. "Congratulations, Jason." Kindly, I said. "I'll have my grandmother drop off some of her famous ointment to help with the growing pains."

"When can I see you again?" Begging, Jason asked. "You have not only captured my heart, you made my one dream come true..."

I turned away from the phone to giggle, blushing. "I think you captured my heart as well." smiling, I replied. "How does next weekend sound?"

"I will count the days!" Excited, Jason said. "Until then, my angel..."

Upon ending the call, I screeched in delight and began to dance around like a little school girl who had gotten her first kiss from her first crush. When I had finished, I turned and blushed profusely as I found Ms Swanson standing at the door, grinning.

"How long have you been standing there?" softly, I demanded.

"Long enough to know whoever was on the phone made your day." Smiling, Ms Swanson replied. "I take it your date with Jason went well."

"He grew five feet after one date with me." Blushing, i said. "He thinks I'm his angel or something, and wants to see me again."

Ms Swanson giggled. "I take it that makes you happy."

I nodded. "It does."
1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.title: A Growing relationship.

choices: The Weekend, and Our Second Date
1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.content:
My family went to their homes, and it was time for me to return to work. I was more than a bit surprised, though, when I got to Old Town Road and found Ms. Swanson waiting for me. "What's going on?" I asked. "I thought you had school."

She giggled. "It's summer, Summer."

With a start, I realized she was right. Since outgrowing the school, I realized that the days just seemed to run together. I set out my lunch, and we decided to eat while I waited for trouble.

As we ate, I asked, "What made Jason grow? He had given up on reaching giant size; next thing you know, he's almost doubled in size."

"When giants start out at a more conventional size," Ms. Swanson explained, "it takes a catalyst to get them growing. For you, it was being doused in a fertilizer made from the fermented fruits that made the first giants grow. For Sam, it was getting pregnant, and finding a grown-up responsibility on her shoulders. I haven't met Jason yet, but, from what you've said about him, I think I can make an educated guess what's spurred his growth."

"Please don't keep me in suspense, ma'am. What is it?"

"The best and most powerful of all catalysts, Summer: true love. He has found the one, and his body is growing to contain his love and happiness."

I felt like I had left the ground. It's one thing to realize you love someone: it's quite another to find out that they love you back.

Our lunch was interrupted by a cry for help.

"Sounds like we've got another amateur climber," I said, getting up. "They hear about how dangerous the cliff is, and they all think they're Tom Cruise or somebody."

I hunkered down at the cliff and asked the man, "Would you prefer to be up or down?"

He picked down, so I climbed down, collected him, and put him on the ground, not far from his car. Then I climbed back up: I was hardly an experienced climber, but I had an advantage: at my size, the 80-foot drop would not be fatal.
1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.title: Back to work.

1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.content:
I had one more rescue to do that day: Boys driving recklessly, as usual.

However, when the EMTs got there, one of them noticed something was different. "You're in a good mood today, big mama," he said. "What's up?"

"I don't want to jinx it," I replied. "Let's just say, if you were where I'm standing, you'd be in a good mood, too." I wasn't ready to talk about Jason with my colleagues just yet. First, I wanted to tell my family all about him.

******************************

When I got home, there was a message for me on the machine. "Summer, it's Mom. We're going to be at Grandma and Grandpa's for a few days. Please call us there. Something's happened. 'Bye."

The first thing that went through my mind was something happening to Sam and the baby. I called Grandma and Grandpa immediately, cursing their slowness to answer with each ring.

Finally, Grandma answered. "Hello?"

"Grandma, it's Summer. I just got home and got the message. Is everybody okay? What happened?"

"Everyone is just fine, Summer. I'm sure your mother didn't mean to worry you. Your family's here because of certain developments with Becca."

"Did she finally get her growth spurt?"

"In a manner of speaking. But it wasn't what she was looking for."

"What do you mean?"

"Becca isn't growing taller, Summer, she's growing stronger."

"Stronger?"

"Your father wanted to change the oil in his car himself, so he jacked it up and got under it. Becca was standing nearby, talking about something or other, when your father bumped the jack and knocked it out of position. Naturally, that brought the car down, or it would have, because Becca caught it. She lifted it quite easily, too."

"But everybody's okay?"

"Just fine, Summer. Your grandpa's teaching Becca how to handle her new strength. And she'll need new clothes: she's got a body like a weightlifter, now. Anyway , what's new with you? Did Jason call?"

"Oh, yeah. I got so worked up about the message, I actually forgot about that. Jason called, with some news of his own: he's started growing."

"He has?"

"Five whole feet in one night. Ms. Swanson thinks I'm the reason why."

"You? You mean he... And how do you feel?"

"He's the one, Grandma. I'm sure of it. I can't wait for you all to meet him."

"I think I'm safe in speaking for the family when I say we want to meet him, too."
1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.title: News from Home

1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.content:
On Friday night, when I got home from work, I found my family waiting for me. I had been told about what happened to Becca, but it was still a surprise to see her. Under the same old face I knew and loved was a physique that most male pro wrestlers would kill to have. "Pick me up," she said. "I want to try something."

Wondering what she had in mind, I lifted her until she told me to stop, at the level of the doorknob. To my surprise, she turned the doorknob and pulled open the door. "I'm impressed," I told her as I set her back down.

"I'm still getting used to this," Becca said.

"Remember how she used to hold giant clothes up in the mirror, and pretend she was wearing them?" Sam asked. "Now she stands in front of the mirror, doing bodybuilder poses." She demonstrated.

"You're looking pretty cut, too," I said.

"I am?" Sam flexed, and felt her own muscle. "I had no idea."

"Well, I hope you can both tear yourselves away from yourselves tomorrow night," I said. "Jason's coming, and I want you all to meet him. He just might make an honest 50-foot woman of me, someday." Someday soon, I hope, I thought.
1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.title: Becca

1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.content:
As promised, Jason came right on schedule. He had had a couple of growth spurts during the week, bringing him up to about 20 feet. "Before we go anywhere," I said, "I would like for you to come inside. There are some people I would like for you to meet."

He stepped inside, and I made introductions. "Jason, these are my grandparents. My parents, Jerry and Annette. My younger sister, Samantha. And my youngest sister, Rebecca. Guys, this is Jason Finnegan."

"Pleased to meet you all," he said.

"Summer's told us so much about you, Jason," Mom said.

"She hardly talks about anything else anymore," Becca added.

Jason chuckled. "All good, I hope."

"Let's put it this way," Sam said. "If somebody came in here who could walk on water, heal the sick, and raise the dead, Summer would probably say, "That's nice. Let me tell you about Jason."

"And, on that note," I said, "it's time for us to go."

As we walked, Jason said, "You really think that much of me?"

"I've done my growing," I said. "I needed some way of showing the world how I feel about you."
1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.title: Jason Meets the Family

1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.content:
If it was a challenge finding a place for a date when one person is of average size and the other is 50 feet tall, it was even harder when both parties were bigger than the average place of business. This time, though, Jason brought the food with him, and a vehicle capable of accommodating at least his size.

For the place, he selected a national park, which was plenty big enough for both of us. No campfire, though: Our bodies generated enough heat for us. Besides, any fire big enough for us would strike terror in the hearts of forest rangers.

"What does all the extra you mean for you becoming a ranger?" I asked.

"It's up in the air," he replied, "until we see how big I get. Certainly, my need for T-shirts and shorts conflicts with the standard uniform."

"I know what you mean. Strapless bikinis aren't standard-issue Search and Rescue uniforms."

Jason changed the subject. "Your family seems nice."

"I'm glad you like them."

"My, uh, my folks want to meet you, too."

"I guess so, since you've given me credit for your growth."

"Would... would you like to meet them?"

"I would be honored, Jason."

"I should warn you, my mother may seem a bit... much."

"I can handle a bit much."
1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.title: Our Second Date

1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.content:
The next day, I went with Jason to meet his family. They lived in a big house out in the woods, so it wasn't hard to see why he wanted to be a ranger.

Jason's mother answered the door, and Jason wasn't kidding when he said she might seem a bit much. For one thing, she was a minimum of 100 feet tall. For another, she was naked, and happily so. "You must be Summer," she said. "Jason's told me so much about you. Come on in. You must be starving."

I was about to say that I was hardly starving, when I remembered that Jason was currently a growing boy.

Jason's father was of slightly more modest proportions, standing at 75 feet tall, but sharing her taste in clothes. I could only imagine how Dad would have responded if I had grown to their size. "You're the young lady working Search and Rescue over on Old Town Road, aren't you?" he asked. "I've seen you on TV. Those folks are lucky to have you."

"Thank you, Mr. Finnegan."

After a few minutes, I stopped noticing that the Finnegans were naked. They were a lot like my parents and grandparents, in that they loved each other and their children, and they weren't afraid to show it.

"Dinner was excellent, Mrs. Finnegan. Can I trouble you for the recipe?"

"Oh, absolutely." She then presented me with an entire cookbook, assuring me that she had committed the recipes to memory.

At home, alone, I tried one of the simpler recipes. I decided I would serve it up the next time my family came over. I also tried walking around the house naked, but I felt too self-conscious about it, even though I was alone.
1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.title: Jason's Family

1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.content:
Ashley and Joey came by later in the week. "Hope we're not intruding," Cathy said.

"Not at all," I reassured her. "After a busy week with Search and Rescue, a visit from you guys is up there on my list of things that make me feel better."

"'Up there' means we're not Number 1 or Number 2," Holly said.

"And we know your family has to be higher than us," Melodie added, "so someone else has taken one of those spots. Tell us, girlfriend: Who is it?"

I blushed. "His name is Jason Finnegan. It... it feels so amazing. I... I really think he's the one."

"And how does he feel about you?" Cathy asked.

"I'm the reason he started growing."

"Growing? You mean he... ?"

"Two weeks ago, he was your size. And, from a family of giants, that really means something. We got fixed up, the sparks flew, and he's been having 5-foot growth spurts ever since."

The doorbell rang. The big doorbell.

When I answered it, there was Jason, now up to 30 feet. "Come on in, Jason. I was just talking about you." I made introductions.

Ashley and Joey were thrilled to meet another giant, much to Jason's surprise. "I first met Ashley back when I was seven and a half feet tall," I explained. "Joey, not long after. They just love giants, and they hope to grow huge when they're older."

"It just might happen, kids," he said. "Now Summer helps save lives, and I'm hoping to be a forest ranger."
1111111111111111111212111121111111111111.title: Ashley and Joey Visit
